block.p: Krista Marisa Abolins, the daughter of Frances and Maris Abolins of East Lansing, Mich., was married yesterday to Nicholas Bartlett Sonne, a son of Sally and Christian R. Sonne of Tuxedo Park, N.Y. The Rev. Dr. Edwin H. Cromey, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at St. Mary's-in-Tuxedo in Tuxedo Park.

Mrs. Sonne, 31, is a manager in the program planning department at VH1, the cable network in New York. She graduated from the University of Michigan, where she also received a law degree. Her father is a professor of physics at Michigan State University, and her mother is an agent at Anderson International Travel, both in East Lansing.

Mrs. Sonne, 31, is a manager in the program planning department at VH1, the cable network in New York. She graduated from the University of Michigan, where she also received a law degree. Mr. Sonne, 29, is studying at the Fordham University Graduate School of Business. He received a bachelor's degree from Bates College. His father is a general partner in Tuxedo Park Associates, a real estate development and sales company, and is the chairman of the trustees of the Berkeley Divinity School at Yale University.
